author: Staff Reporter
text:
Transgenders have a reason to cheer - the Chennai City Police is holding a job fair exclusively for them.

A senior official of the City Police said the job fair, which was the brain child of City Police Commissioner T.K. Rajendran, will be held at a hotel in the city on Tuesday.

Several non-governmental oraganisations, self-help groups and private companies would participate in the job fair, to which over 350 transgenders have already given their applications.

The job fair is the culmination of several meetings held with social activist Shobana Ramesh.

The police would be the facilitating agency in vetting the job applications and creating a database of job profiles and processing the job applicants.

The official said more than 80 per cent of the transgenders who had submitted their applications have passed out of Class X.
title: Police to hold job mela for transgenders
